block.para: Shows how to use the &NETlong; to create a web application that tracks work items in an &AURlong; database and emails reports by using &SESlong; (&SES;). This example uses a front end built with React.js to interact with a RESTful .NET backend.

listitem.para: Integrate a React web application with &AWS; services.
List, add, update, and delete items in an &AUR; table.
Send an email report of filtered work items using &SES;.
Deploy and manage example resources with the included &CFNlong; script.

block.para: For complete source code and instructions on how to set up and run, see the full example on GitHub.
